Apple___Apple_scab: Apply fungicides containing captan or myclobutanil. Remove fallen leaves and prune for better air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.
Apple___Black_rot: Use copper-based fungicides early in season. Remove infected fruits immediately. Ensure proper sanitation and avoid wetting foliage.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Apply preventive fungicides in spring before symptoms appear. Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Use resistant apple varieties.
Apple___healthy: Your apple plant looks healthy! Continue with regular care: proper watering, balanced fertilization, and regular pruning.
Blueberry___healthy: Your blueberry plant looks healthy! Maintain consistent watering, acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5), and regular mulching.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Apply sulfur-based fungicides or baking soda spray. Improve air circulation around plants. Water at soil level, not on leaves. Prune for better airflow.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: Your cherry plant looks healthy! Continue proper pruning, adequate watering, and protection from birds.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Use fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole. Practice crop rotation with non-host crops. Manage crop residue properly.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust: Apply fungicides with propiconazole or tebuconazole. Choose resistant varieties for future planting. Ensure good field sanitation.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Use fungicides and practice 2-3 year crop rotation. Remove infected plant debris. Plant resistant varieties when available.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: Your corn plant looks healthy! Maintain proper spacing, adequate nutrition, and consistent soil moisture.
Grape___Black_rot: Apply fungicides with mancozeb or copper sulfate. Remove infected berries immediately. Improve air circulation through proper pruning.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): No effective chemical treatment available. Prune infected wood during dormant season. Improve vineyard management and reduce plant stress.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Apply copper-based fungicides. Improve air circulation and reduce humidity around vines. Remove infected leaves.
Grape___healthy: Your grape plant looks healthy! Continue with proper pruning, disease prevention, and balanced nutrition.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): No cure available - this is a serious disease. Remove infected trees immediately to prevent spread. Control Asian citrus psyllid with approved insecticides. Consult agricultural extension immediately.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Apply copper bactericides during dormant season and early spring. Use resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation and work when plants are dry.
Peach___healthy: Your peach tree looks healthy! Continue regular pruning, thinning fruits, and monitoring for pests.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Use copper bactericides and practice crop rotation. Avoid overhead watering. Use pathogen-free seeds and transplants.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: Your pepper plant looks healthy! Maintain consistent watering, good nutrition, and support for heavy fruit loads.
Potato___Early_blight: Apply fungicides with chlorothalonil or mancozeb at first sign of disease. Remove infected leaves. Improve air circulation and avoid overhead watering.
Potato___Late_blight: Apply fungicides with metalaxyl or mancozeb immediately - this spreads rapidly. Avoid overhead irrigation. Ensure good drainage and destroy infected plants.
Potato___healthy: Your potato plant looks healthy! Continue with proper hilling, consistent moisture, and monitoring for pests.
Raspberry___healthy: Your raspberry plant looks healthy! Maintain proper pruning, support systems, and good air circulation.
Soybean___healthy: Your soybean plant looks healthy! Continue monitoring for pests and diseases, and maintain proper nutrition.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate sprays (1 tablespoon per gallon water). Improve air circulation and avoid overhead watering. Remove infected leaves.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Remove affected leaves immediately. Improve air circulation around plants. Apply appropriate fungicides if disease persists. Avoid overhead watering.
Strawberry___healthy: Your strawberry plant looks healthy! Maintain proper spacing, good drainage, and remove old leaves regularly.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Use copper bactericides and practice 3-year crop rotation. Avoid working with wet plants. Use pathogen-free seeds and avoid overhead irrigation.
Tomato___Early_blight: Apply fungicides with chlorothalonil or copper. Remove lower leaves touching soil. Improve air circulation and mulch around plants.
Tomato___Late_blight: Apply fungicides with metalaxyl immediately - this is serious! Remove infected plants completely. Avoid overhead watering and ensure good air circulation.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Improve greenhouse ventilation significantly. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil. Reduce humidity levels below 85%.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Use fungicides with chlorothalonil or copper. Remove infected leaves from bottom up. Mulch around plants and avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Increase humidity around plants. Use insecticidal soap or neem oil. Release beneficial predatory mites. Spray undersides of leaves.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Apply fungicides with azoxystrobin or chlorothalonil. Improve air circulation and avoid overhead irrigation. Remove infected debris.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: No direct treatment available. Control whitefly vectors with insecticides or yellow sticky traps. Remove infected plants to prevent spread.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: No cure available. Remove infected plants immediately. Control aphid vectors. Use virus-free seeds and resistant varieties.
Tomato___healthy: Your tomato plant looks healthy! Continue with proper support, regular watering, and balanced nutrition.
general_low_confidence:
I'm not fully confident about this disease identification. For best results, please:
1. Take a clearer, well-lit photo of the affected area
2. Ensure the diseased part is clearly visible
3. Consult with a local agricultural expert or extension service
4. Consider getting a professional plant disease diagnosis
general_prevention:
General disease prevention tips:
• Ensure good air circulation around plants
• Water at soil level, avoid wetting leaves
• Remove infected plant material immediately
• Practice crop rotation
• Use clean tools and hands
• Maintain proper plant spacing
• Apply mulch to prevent soil splashing
